results.title: Comparative Analysis of Adverse Event Profiles Among Seven Statins for Hypercholesterolemia Management Using the United States FDA Adverse Event Reporting System.
results.text_hl: Results With @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ as the reference, five statins (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_pitavastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C108475 @@@pitavastatin@@@) demonstrated both significant ROR > 1 and aROR > 1 for @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal disorders@@@.

citations.NLM: Ogura T, Shiraishi C. Comparative Analysis of Adverse Event Profiles Among Seven Statins for Hypercholesterolemia Management Using the United States FDA Adverse Event Reporting System. Cureus. 2025 Mar;17(3):e81260. PMID: 40291284

results.text_hl: Common clinical adverse effects reported with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ use include @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headaches@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal complaints@@@.

results.title: Long-term efficacy and tolerability of simvastatin in a large cohort of elderly hypercholesterolemic patients.
results.text_hl: Side-effects were mild and most frequently @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal@@@ in nature.

citations.NLM: Lansberg PJ, Mitchel YB, Shapiro D, Kastelein JJ, Altman R, Jerums G, Bolzano K, Giannini S, Davignon J, DeWailly P. Long-term efficacy and tolerability of simvastatin in a large cohort of elderly hypercholesterolemic patients. Atherosclerosis. 1995 Aug;116(2):153-62. PMID: 7575771

results.title: Dose-finding study of high-dose simvastatin combined with standard chemotherapy in patients with relapsed or refractory myeloma or lymphoma.
results.text_hl: The maximum tolerated dose was 15 mg/kg/day @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. The most frequently reported side-effects were @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal CTC@@@ grade 1-2 and @DISEASE_Fever @DISEASE_MESH:D005334 @@@neutropenic fever@@@.

citations.NLM: van der Spek E, Bloem AC, van de Donk NW, Bogers LH, van der Griend R, Kramer MH, de Weerdt O, Wittebol S, Lokhorst HM. Dose-finding study of high-dose simvastatin combined with standard chemotherapy in patients with relapsed or refractory myeloma or lymphoma. Haematologica. 2006 Apr;91(4):542-5. PMID: 16585018

results.title: [HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors in familial hypercholesterolemia. Therapy with simvastatin alone and in combination with cholestyramine in low dosage; a report of 2 years experiences].
results.text_hl: Some @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ developed @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal complaints@@@, which made necessary a reduction of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in two cases.
